case_vignette: A 20-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a circular hypopigmented lesion on her right cheek. The patient stated that she used to have a mole in the same location. Over time she noticed a white area around the mole that enlarged to the current size of the lesion. After a few months she noticed the mole in the center of the lesion had disappeared. On further questioning, she denies any personal or family history of skin cancer.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have this round, lighter patch on my right cheek where I used to have a mole.
How long has the patch been there?
The white area started appearing a few months ago and got bigger to what it is now.
Have you noticed any similar patches elsewhere on your body?
No, I haven't noticed similar patches anywhere else on my body.
Did the mole change in appearance before you noticed the white patch?
No, the mole didn't change; it just had the white area around it that got bigger until the mole was gone.
Have you recently started any new medications or treatments?
No, I haven't started any new medications or treatments.
Do you have any personal or family history of autoimmune diseases or skin conditions?
No, I don't have any personal or family history of skin cancer or autoimmune diseases.
Have you had any recent exposures to chemicals, skin irritants, or significant sun exposure?
No, I haven't had any exposure to chemicals, skin irritants, or significant sun exposure.
Is there any itching, pain, or change in sensation on or around the lighter patch?
No, there's no itching, pain, or change in sensation on or around the lighter patch.
Final Diagnosis: Vitiligo.
